body:
I found the answer to my own question. I forgot to pass the NSFetchResultContoller into the controllerWillChangeContent and controllerDidChangeContent functions. Witch lead to the crash.

I corrected the code as follows:

func controllerWillChangeContent(_ controller: NSFetchedResultsController<NSFetchRequestResult>) {
    tableView.beginUpdates()
}

func controllerDidChangeContent(_ controller: NSFetchedResultsController<NSFetchRequestResult>) {
    tableView.endUpdates()
}

Now everything seems to work just fine.
title: Swift 3 Sectioned NSFetchResultController
